titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Murray L. Weidenbaum papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Beth Goder

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-02-13T08:13-0800
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English

did.unittitle: Murray L. Weidenbaum papers
did.abstract: Speeches and writings, pamphlets, and clippings, relating to American federal credit programs, business and inflation, government regulation of business, utility regulation, and military-industrial relations.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Murray L. Weidenbaum papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1977.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Bronx, New York
B.A., City College of New York
M.A., Columbia University
Fiscal economist, United States Bureau of the Budget
Ph.D., Princeton University
Corporate economist, Boeing Company
Senior economist, Stanford Research Institute
Faculty member, Washington University in St. Louis
Author, The Modern Public Sector: New Ways of Doing the Government's Business
Assistant secretary of the treasury for economic policy, Department of the Treasury, United States
Author, The Economics of Peacetime Defense
Director, Center for the Study of American Business (later renamed the Weidenbaum Center), Washington University in St. Louis
Author, Government-Mandated Price Increases: A Neglected Aspect of Inflation
Author, Business, Government, and the Public
Author, The Future of Business Regulation: Private Action and Public Demand
Chairman, Council of Economic Advisors
Author, Rendezvous with Reality: The American Economy After Reagan
Author, Small Wars, Big Defense: Paying for the Military After the Cold War
Chairman, Center for the Study of American Business (later renamed the Weidenbaum Center), Washington University in St. Louis
Author, The Bamboo Network: How Expatriate Chinese Entrepreneurs are Creating a New Economic Superpower in Asia, with Samuel Hughes
Honorary chairman, Weidenbaum Center on the Economy
Author, Business and Government in the Global Marketplace
Author, The Competition of Ideas: The World of Washington Think Tanks
Author, The Competition of Ideas: The World of the Washington Think Tanks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the career of American economist Murry L. Weidenbaum through speeches and writings, pamphlets, and clippings related to American federal credit programs, business and inflation, government regulation of business, utility regulation, and military-industrial relations.

The majority of the collection consists of Murry L. Weidenbaum's speeches and writings on economic topics such as military markets, defense spending, revenue sharing, subsidies, and government regulation. The writings include statements prepared for the United States Senate and House of Representatives.
